Title: Aethon Completes Acquisition of Tellurian Upstream and Midstream Assets - Business Wire
Summary: Aethon Energy Management LLC announced the successful acquisition of Tellurian's integrated upstream assets, expanding Aethon's footprint in the Haynesville Shale to approximately 375,000 net acres. The deal includes a Heads of Agreement for two metric tons per annum of LNG from the Driftwood LNG project. This acquisition aims to enhance Aethon's strategic position and support its goal of providing net-zero natural gas to both domestic and international customers.

Title: Aethon Completes Acquisition of Tellurian Upstream and Midstream Assets - Chronicle-Tribune
Summary: Aethon Energy Management LLC has completed the acquisition of Tellurian's integrated upstream and midstream assets. This acquisition includes approximately 375,000 net acres in the Haynesville Shale and a Heads of Agreement for two metric tons per annum of LNG from the Driftwood LNG project. The transaction strengthens Aethon's position as a leading low-emission natural gas producer and supports the broader energy transition.

Title: Bedford gas leak after drilling company hits natural gas pocket - BBC.com
Summary: A drilling company in Bedford caused a gas leak after hitting a natural gas pocket while drilling a borehole for a heat pump. The incident led to road closures and a response from Bedfordshire Fire and Rescue to cap the borehole and control the gas flow. The situation is being managed in coordination with emergency services, and the borehole will be permanently closed.

Title: Aethon completes acquisition of Tellurian upstream and midstream assets - World Pipelines
Summary: Aethon Energy Management LLC has successfully closed the acquisition of Tellurian's upstream and midstream assets, expanding its footprint in the Haynesville Shale to approximately 375,000 net acres. This acquisition includes a Heads of Agreement for two metric tons per annum of LNG from the Driftwood LNG project. The partnership between Aethon and Tellurian aims to advance the development of Driftwood and secure buyers for its remaining capacity, validating the role of U.S. LNG as a global transition fuel.
